title: Which is the best app to listen to music offline (apple)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, it depends on what you mean by offline. You can download songs and not access the files with SoundCloud Go, which starts at $4.99 a month. There are some rumors that SoundCloud is dying, though those have been around for months as of September 2017, and SoundCloud is still running fine. SoundCloud is the #1 goto place for most underground or independent artists to post their music. If you like underground music, I'd recommend SoundCloud. (Go Premium - Listen to music) You can download songs and not access the files with Spotify Premium, which is $9.99 a month. Spotify's focus is more on large record labels, so you'll get a lot more big-name artists when using Spotify. (Music for everyone.) You can download actual song files using Bandcamp. You'll get a choice between WAV, MP3, FLAC, and more formats that you can play using iTunes, Amazon Music, or whatever player you like that plays local files. It's used by mostly independent or underground artists. (Bandcamp) You can download songs and not access the files with YouTube Red, which has a semi-okay-I-guess UI for music, and has a large combination of both big-name artists and underground music. (YouTube Red - YouTube)

Jam Music[1] , hands down. Here’s why: When you hear music with friends, do you ever have to share a pair of earbuds?  Now you don’t have to! With the Jam app, you can invite your friends (of all ages) and listen to music with them live and at the same time, whether you’re right next to each other or in different countries. What you can do: Add your favorite songs to your listJoin friends’ live Jams or start your ownMessage friends on the app as you listen with themJam with celebrities who have the appIt’s also a great way to discover new songs, because it’s not a computer that suggests the songs. Here’s what it looks like. I am currently listening to “Up Down.”  You can always Jam by yourself if you want, where you’ll meet people with similar music tastes. Footnotes [1] Jam Music - Tune in.
